<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 193, 201]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 170, 250]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 214, 422, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[619, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 214, 902, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 293]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 267, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 415, 374]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper. No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 387, 406]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 718, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 764, 560]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions. Electronic calculators may be used. You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 758, 600]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 95, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
A student watches a car race around a track. He uses a stopwatch to measure the time for the car to make one lap of the track.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 918, 151]]<|/det|>
The student forgets to reset the stopwatch at the start of the race. Fig. 1.1 shows the time on the stopwatch at the start and the time after going around the track once.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 163, 868, 375]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 390, 532, 408]]<|/det|>
<pre>Fig. 1.1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 422, 753, 440]]<|/det|>
Calculate the time the car takes to go around the track once, in seconds.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[528, 514, 918, 530]]<|/det|>
<form>time = ............................................................ s [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 545, 148, 564]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 545, 918, 577]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 592, 542, 609]]<|/det|>
Calculate the average speed of the car in m/s.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 700, 918, 717]]<|/det|>
<form>average speed = ......................................................... m/s [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
